page.title: 05BUILDINGS IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: There are many buildings in the village some of which are 17th century-Tytherleigh Cot and the George Inn.The Court Manor house of the village once belonged to the Bishops of Salisbury and some early documents were dated at Chardstock.There is a shop which is part of a house in the village.Tytherleigh Cot is a Hotel and is used by business men and for Conferences.The church was first built round about the 12th century and then it was rebuilt in 1864.The south wall is all that is left of the original building.There is a Garden Gnome centre in the agricultural contractor and builders yard where they make alot of concrete Gnomes and birds. The School is a very old building.It was first built as a college between 1854-1856.The 18th Century Workhouse has been converted into houses.
